Posts.Content: I sure hope you get a lot more time on the Ibrance! I’m on Afinitor and Exemestane since 12/28/18. On 2/1, one of my tumor markers dropped significantly. But, I’ve had low grade temperatures, and very bad pain in my sides. I spent a day in the ER last week and not a thing showed up that could be causing it. The ER doctor was on the phone constantly with my oncologist. I’ve tended to experience rarer side effects with the various medications. And I’m thinking this is possibly one of those instances. So I’m determined to tough it out! Blessings!
Posts.Title: Commercials for Ibrance, etc.

Posts.Content: I’d like the big pharma lobbying to end. As much as I’m for less regulations, the drug pricing basically eliminates many who could truly benefit. If I weren’t working and paying for really good medical coverage, and if I were on Medicare, my oncologist told me it would be $2300/21 days out of pocket. My oncologist must have provided my contact info to an organization that helps with copays for Xgeva. When they called me, the first question was, and I quote “Are you on Medicare because if you are you won’t qualify for this program.”
Posts.Title: Commercials for Ibrance, etc.

Posts.Content: I couldn’t agree more! Mouth sores, fevers, and the fatigue! My skin changed and my hair completely changed texture. Let’s put it this way, if I was out of Brillo I could use my head to get that stubborn baked on food off the pan, lol. Also, coworkers saw the commercial and questioned me because I had to work from home while on it. The risk of infection was too great where I work. They saw the commercial and thought I was having a good ole time at home! Ibrance stopped working for me after 2 years, however, despite the side effects, I’m hugely grateful it was available for me. That said, the vast majority of the almost 9 years at Stage 4, have been relatively normal. The past 2 years have been a very trying “new normal.”
Posts.Title: Commercials for Ibrance, etc.
